title: In 1 Viral Post, Mom Gloriously Slams People Who Called Her Breastfeeding Pictures "Gross"
text:
Mom Responds to Troll Who Called Breastfeeding Photos Gross In 1 Viral Post, Mom Gloriously Slams People Who Called Her Breastfeeding Pictures "Gross" February 22, 2017 A post shared by Nadine Muller >ï‘» _nadinemuller (@_nadinemuller) on Feb 19, 2017 at 1:09am PST 
Nadine Muller is no stranger to sharing breastfeeding photos with her followers on social media. The Australian fitness blogger and registered nurse usually garners positive reactions for the snapshots of her feeding her 16-month-old son, Madden, but when one Instagram troll called her photos "gross" and "weird," Nadine knew she had to take a stand. 
The Aussie mom posted a slideshow of various breastfeeding photos with the most glorious caption ever. "There is nothing 'weird' or 'gross' about these photos," she wrote. "There's no difference in me feeding my child with my breast than someone feeding him/herself with a spoon!" 
Nadine went on to stand up for a mother's right to share such photos publicly. "How about we simply appreciate that any mother has options, the right to her own choices, to feel supported and respected, the right to not have to hide, in fact the right to SHARE and POST proudly if she feels comfortable to do so!" ADVERTISEMENT 
She explained that moms don't share breastfeeding photos for attention or to make a statement. Rather, "They post because they are #proud, to give other mums encouragement," she wrote. "They post so that other mums feel accepted, supported, and respected." Nadine said that nursing is a "beautiful act" that demonstrates a bond between a mother and her baby, and that bond should be openly celebrated. We couldn't agree more! 
Nadine ends her message on an encouraging note, advising mamas everywhere to post photos of them feeding their children, whether it be by breast, bottle, or spoon, using the hashtag #wefeedunited. Related:
